books.title: Misalliance
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On a pleasant summer afternoon, a sudden plane crash followed by a would-be assassin interrupt a family’s conversations about marriage.

books.title: The Defiant Agents
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: Rival colonies are stranded on an alien world, their memories mixed with those of their ancestors and pitted against each other by the Western and Soviet forces who sent them.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Blue Bird
books.author: Maurice Maeterlinck
books.summary: Two children go on a magical adventure in search of the Blue Bird.

books.title: Tartuffe
books.author: Molière
books.summary: A father announces his daughter will marry Tartuffe, a sanctimonious fraud and hypocrite.

books.title: The Mule-Bone
books.author: Langston Hughes
books.summary: A guitarist and a dancer compete for the same woman’s affection.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The Pilgrim’s Progress
books.author: John Bunyan
books.summary: An allegorical story of a pilgrim in search of redemption, followed later by his wife and children, passing through great trials before reaching the Celestial City.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: Mystery at Lynden Sands
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: A Chief Constable’s holiday on the coast is interrupted when he is drawn into investigating a murder.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: Thus Spake Zarathustra
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: After ten years spent in solitude, Zarathustra goes back amongst men to share his accumulated wisdom and prepare humanity for the Overman.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of poems by Oscar Wilde.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: The Time Traders
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: A young criminal volunteers for a government project at a secret base.

books.title: The League of the Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
